nouns: A circular hand sign
An A-ok is both a saying, derived from okay, and a hand-gesture done by connecting the thumb and index finger into a circle, and holding the other fingers straight or relaxed in the air.

description:
A gesture showing the index finger and thumb touching to make an open circle. Represents “I’m okay” or “yes, that’s correct / good”.

In American Sign Language (ASL), the number nine is represented with this gesture. The same hand sign can be seen as offensive in some cultures, including in parts of Europe, the Middle East, and South America.

This can also be used as a symbol of White Supremacy, depending on context.
apple_vendor_description: The OK Hand emoji on Apple devices is rendered with a clean, crisp white palm and a perfectly formed thumb and index finger meeting to create a precise circle. Its smooth, 3D shading gives it a polished, almost tangible feel, embodying a sense of approval, agreement, or well-being. This emoji from Apple's collection is universally understood to signify that everything is alright, good to go, or excellent.
